titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Nancy Babb papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Lora Soroka

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-05-20T11:35-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, and memoranda, relating to American Relief Administration and American Friends Service Committee work in Russia.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to audiovisual materials requires at least two weeks advance notice. Audiovisual materials include sound recordings, video recordings, and motion picture film. Hoover staff will determine whether use copies of the materials requested can be made available. Some materials may not be accessible even with advance notice. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives for further information.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Nancy Babb papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Nancy Babb was an American Relief Administration and American Friends Service Committee relief worker in Russia from 1917 to 1925.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, and memoranda, relating to American Relief Administration and American Friends Service Committee work in Russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes The Case of Tyler Kent by John Howland Snow and newspaper clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Include recollection of Hermann Maskovski, resident of Koenigsberg (now Kaliningrad) about life in the city after the end of World War II. Translated from Russian.

did.unittitle: Correspondence and other materials relating to work of the American Friends Service Committee and Society of Friends in Russia,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes architectural drawing of a hospital building in Russia; financial documents; newspaper clippings; peace poster stamps; one photograph depicting Stalin with other Soviet leaders; and one photograph depicting Nancy Babb

did.unittitle: Reports, financial accounts, surveys, minutes, tables, and other documents relating to activities of the Friends International Service, Society of Friends, and health care in Russia,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes one poster and a report to N. A. Semashko, People's Commissar of Health (in box 1, folder 21); printed matter (box 2, folder 1), some correspondence (box 2, folder 4), general plan of a hospital (box 2, folder 9)

did.unittitle: Printed matter relating to the 1939 National Peace Poster Content,
